Gift to Kim Jong Il from Fidel Castro Ruz 
   Havana, September 17 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba.
 It was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Sunday.

Greetings to PM of St. Kitts and Nevis 
   Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Denzil Douglas, prime minister of St. Kitts and Nevis, on the occasion of the 23rd anniversary of its independence.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would be boosted in mutual interests.

S. Korean Organizations Vow to Struggle for Rights of Unionists 
   Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Different social organizations in south Korea including the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, the "National Federation of Peasants Associations", the "National Professors' Union", the Solidarity for Social Progress, the Bar Association for a Democratic Society reportedly called a press conference in front of the "government" building in Seoul on Sept. 12 to declare the inauguration of a joint emergency measure committee to check the "government's" suppression of the "National Government Employees' Union."
 Speakers at the conference accused the "government" of threatening to close all branch offices of the union across south Korea till Sept. 22 in the wake of its forcible closure of the office of the South Kyongsang Provincial Headquarters of the union.    
 It is quite natural for the government employees to have the three rights of labour guaranteed, they claimed, calling for protecting the rights without fail.
